sample_docs: Ideco Biometrics Standard Warranty For peace of mind, we recommend you only deal with one of our Certified Partners when selecting a biometric solution. Ideco offers free support to all our Certified Partners and their Customers who purchase biometric solutions from them. For real time remote support, Ideco's expert support team uses TeamViewer for secure connections to your site, guiding you to a resolution. 1. GENERAL ‍ 1.1. The Warranty set out below is only applicable to the Morpho range of Biometric Terminals and Services related to these specific products that are subject to their normal and manufacturer intended use and when covered under this warranty shall include only its original manufacturer configuration, design, specifications and intended use. 1.2. Ideco Biometric Security Solutions (here after also referred to as "Ideco, we, us or our") undertakes to furnish without charge, labour and/or replacement parts necessary to repair or replace products covered by this warranty that are found to have defects in the materials,components or manufacturing faults subject to the of this warranty. 1.3. Ideco make no satisfaction, performance, risk free, error free or merchantability, guarantees or warranties. 1.4. In the case where software licenses that are embedded in products that are covered by this warranty, need to be replaced, Ideco reserve the right to charge a handling fee for this service. 1.5. This warranty is only applicable to products purchased from Ideco or our authorized dealers and retailers registered on our stock system. 1.6. To be eligible for the warranty coverage, you will at our discretion, have to show a legible, valid proof of purchase that shows compliance with the relevant warranty periods indicated below. 1.7. If during the warranty period the product is determined to be defective due to improper materials or workmanship such defective parts covered under this warranty shall be repaired or replaced free of charge (with comparable and/or refurbished equipment or parts) as determined by us in our sole discretion and all such replaced parts become the property of Ideco. ‍ 1.8. Any defects which can reasonably be discovered through visual inspections on the date of purchase or immediately thereafter must be reported within thirty (30)days of date of purchase, failing which, no such defects will be deemed to be present at the time of purchase. ‍ 1.9. All claims relating to this warranty must be supported in writing by, or processed through, our authorized distributor or retailer where you have purchased the product. ‍ 1.10. This warranty is governed under the South African Consumer Protection Act and does not affect your statutory rights as a consumer in anyway and our decisions regarding all matters concerning this warranty shall be final and binding. 1.11. None of our employees, distributors, dealers, retailers,contractors, agents have the authority to vary, modify or amend any of the of this warranty and any changes are only valid if published on our website. ‍ 2. WARRANTY PERIODS 2.1. Warranty Period ‍ ‍2.1.1. Thewarranty period commences from the date of purchase (Ideco Invoice Date) of aproduct covered by this warranty and ends strictly one calendar year from thestart date. 2.1.2. Where a product has been repaired Ideco such repairs shall be warranted for ninety (90) days from the date of collection or remain under the balance of the original warranty (whichever period is the greater) under the same conditions. 2.2 Extended Warranty Period Ideco does offer an extended warranty period on the products and services covered by this warranty at an additional charge through our "Swop Out" Program. 3. WARRANTY EXCLUSIONS 3.1. This warranty does not cover minor imperfections that meet the manufacturer's design specifications and that do not materially alter the intended product functionality. ‍ 3.2. This warranty does not cover products which were not purchased in accordance with the herein, without valid proof of purchase and/or with proof of purchase that has been altered or illegible. 3.3. This warranty does not cover product which has been tampered with or altered in anyway or damaged as a result of operator negligence, incorrect installation,repairs that were not made by the Ideco Customer Care Centre, general misuse or abuse, or any damages caused by fire, water, electrical surges, related software, civil disturbances or an act of God are not covered by this warranty. 3.4. This warrantee does not cover products that have been discontinued by the manufacturer. 3.5. This warranty does not cover normal wear and tear and cosmetic damage such as, but not limited to corrosion, scratches, dents, rust, stains. Non- functional parts such as, but not limited to, plastics and finishes. Expendable or lost items, such as, but not limited to cables, connectors or head surge protection devices. 3.6. This warranty does not include the cost of transport or delivery to and from Ideco's Customer Service Centre facility and any such costs including insurances,handling fees, applicable taxes and/or other incidental charges shall be borne by the end user. 3.7. Unless otherwise provided herein, coverage does not and will not apply to any consumables, non-functional parts and/ or accessories that are used in conjunction with or to enhance the performance of the covered product. 3.8. Any express or implied warrantees including but not limited to fitness for a particular purpose whether by statute, common law or otherwise are excluded from this warranty to the maximum extent permissible by the applicable law. 4. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY Save for damage caused by our own gross negligence, the remedies in this warranty are the purchaser's sole and exclusive remedies and our liability, howsoever arising out of, relating to or in connection with this warranty, shall not under any circumstances exceed the product purchase price. 5. INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL IR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OR LOSSES To the maximum extent permissible under applicable laws, Ideco, including our affiliates, agents, contractors, sub-contractors, installers, resellers, distributors, partners) will not under any circumstances or legal theory (whether based in contract, tort or otherwise) be liable for any indirect, incidental or consequential loss and or damages, including without limitation, property damage, lost time, loss of use, loss of data, delays in servicing or the inability to render service on the products covered by this warrantee. 6. CHANGES TO THIS WARRANTY We reserve the right to vary, modify or change the herein due to change(s) in availability of services,products and/or spare parts or for the purposes of complying with applicable policies, rules, regulations and law, at our discretion with or without notice. The latest version of this warranty is available on https://www.ideco.co.za/bimswarranty. Ideco Biometrics For peace of mind, Ideco deals with you data in a responsible manner and updates the regularly. This describes how your personal information is collected, used, and shared when you visit or make a purchase from https://www.ideco.co.za (the "Site"). PERSONAL INFORMATION WE COLLECT When you visit the Site, we automatically collect certain information about your device, including information about your web browser, IP address, time zone, and some of the cookies that are installed on your device. Additionally, as you browse the Site, we collect information about the individual web pages or products that you view, what websites or search referred you to the Site, and information about how you interact with the Site. We refer to this automatically-collected information as "Device Information." We collect Device Information using the following technologies: - "Cookies" are data files that are placed on your device or computer and often include an anonymous unique identifier. For more information about cookies, and how to disable cookies, visit http://www.allaboutcookies.org. - "Log files" track actions occurring on the Site, and collect data including your IP address, browser type, Internet service provider, referring/exit pages, and date/time stamps. - "Web beacons,""tags," and "pixels" are electronic files used to record information about how you browse the Site. Additionally when you make a purchase or attempt to make a purchase through the Site, we collect certain information from you, including your name, billing address, shipping address, payment information (including credit card numbers), email address, and phone number. We refer to this information as "Order Information." When we talk about "Personal Information" in this , we are talking both about Device Information and Order Information. HOW DO WE USE YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION? We use the Order Information that we collect generally to fulfill any orders placed through the Site (including processing your payment information, arranging for shipping, and providing you with invoices and/or order confirmations). Additionally, we use this Order Information to: ‍ - Communicate with you; - Screen our orders for potential risk or fraud; and - When in line with the preferences you have shared with us, provide you with information or advertising relating to our products or services. We use the Device Information that we collect to help us screen for potential risk and fraud (in particular, your IP address), and more generally to improve and optimize our Site (for example, by generating analytics about how our customers browse and interact with the Site, and to assess the success of our marketing and advertising campaigns). SHARING YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION We share your Personal Information with third parties to help us use your Personal Information, as described above. We also use Google Analytics to help us understand how our customers use the Site--you can read more about how Google uses your Personal Information here: https://www.google.com/intl/en/policies/privacy/. You can also opt-out of Google Analytics here: https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout. Finally, we may also share your Personal Information to comply with applicable laws and regulations, to respond to a subpoena, search warrant or other lawful request for information we receive, or to otherwise protect our rights. BEHAVIOURAL ADVERTISING ‍ As described above, we use your Personal Information to provide you with targeted advertisements or marketing communications we believe may be of interest to you. For more information about how targeted advertising works, you can visit the Network Advertising Initiative's ("NAI") educational page at http://www.networkadvertising.org/understanding-online-advertising/how-does-it-work. You can opt out of targeted advertising by: FACEBOOK - https://www.facebook.com/settings/?tab=ads GOOGLE - https://www.google.com/settings/ads/anonymous BING - https://advertise.bingads.microsoft.com/en-us/resources/policies/personalized-ads ‍ Additionally, you can opt out of some of these services by visiting the Digital Advertising Alliance's opt-out portal at: https://optout.aboutads.info/ DO NOT TRACK Please note that we do not alter our Site's data collection and use practices when we see a Do Not Track signal from your browser. YOUR RIGHTS If you are a European resident, you have the right to access personal information we hold about you and to ask that your personal information be corrected, updated, or deleted. If you would like to exercise this right, please contact us through the contact information below. Additionally, if you are a European resident we note that we are processing your information in order to fulfill contracts we might have with you (for example if you make an order through the Site), or otherwise to pursue our legitimate business interests listed above. Additionally, please note that your information will be transferred outside of Europe, including to Canada and the United States. DATA RETENTION ‍ When you place an order through the Site, we will maintain your Order Information for our records unless and until you ask us to delete this information. CHANGES ‍ We may update this from time to time in order to reflect, for example, changes to our practices or for other operational,legal or regulatory reasons. CONTACT US ‍ For more information about our privacy practices, if you have questions, or if you would like to make a complaint, please contact us by e-mail at contact@ideco.co.za or by mail using the details provided below: 1287 Embankmentroad, corner Lenchen South, Centurion, 011, 0157, South Africa We focus on Identity We understand biometrics We innovate new solutions We never compromise We make a difference Copyright © Ideco Biometrics

Ideco Biometrics nu ID App For peace of mind, Ideco deals with personal data in a responsible manner and updates the regularly. nu ID is a complete digital identity ecosystem that allows every citizen to have a digitised version of their physical ID card on their smart phone, which is backed by an online certificate of authenticity that is digitally signed with an advanced crypto key. In addition nu ID also provides you with a fast, secure and convenient way to check Identity related information of someone else when you are in doubt and want to make suure they are who they claim to be. WILL nu ID GIVE ME A HANIS REPORT? nu ID offers various verification tools via your mobile phone. When you use "CertifyID", you will get a full report from HANIS, only once their fingerprints were matched. The report will also be emailed to you and will contain all the relevant information about the person, including their registered photo. This report is a certified proof of their identity. WILL nu ID BE ABLE TO DO CRIMINAL CHECKS? Currently the nu ID App cannot be used to do criminal checks as this require special integration to the SAPS system. We are however continuously adding new verification features to the nu ID App and once this becomes available, we will notify you. WILL WE SHARE YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION? nuID is the first Digital Identity Platform that completely protects your personal information. Every user has full control over their personal information only when you specifically authorise it, will your information be released. You are always in control. WHAT ARE THE COSTS PER TRANSACTION? ‍ You are only billed once a transactions was successfully processed by the nu ID platform. The following costs would apply: Check ID - R3.99 Verify ID - R6.99 Certify ID - R32.99 Verify Account - R16.99 Please note that all transsactions are billed through your own mobile account. IS THERE AN API AVAILABLE FOR DIRECT INTEGRATION TO THESE SERVICES? Should you require to integrate these services into your existing business processes, please contact us at contact@ideco.co.za for more information about Ideco's Identity as a Service solution. IDaaS offers a real-time B2B solution at very affordable prices via a secure API. For more information about IDaaS, please visit www.idaas.app We focus on Identity We understand biometrics We innovate new solutions We never compromise We make a difference Copyright © Ideco Biometrics

Identity fraud costs businesses billions, and outdated checks won't protect you. Smart companies know that secure growth starts with knowing who you're dealing with. Identity-as-a-Service for Business-to-Business (IDaaS B2B) platform offers fast, seamless identity verification, helping you stay compliant, prevent fraud, and protect your business from hidden risks before they become costly problems. As security threats evolve, businesses need reliable, compliant, and future-proof solutions. Ideco Biometrics, in partnership with IDEMIA, delivers cutting-edge biometric security to protect businesses, estates, and sensitive data. With ethical data handling, advanced hardware, and expert training, we ensure seamless integration and long-term security. Build a safer future today. Users don't have to go through multiple ID checks – the single API automates the process efficiently. Faster, more secure onboarding. In today's digital world, businesses need fast, secure, and scalable identity verification. Ideco Biometrics' single API unifies biometric authentication, document verification, and fraud detection into one seamless system—enhancing security, reducing fraud, and simplifying compliance. Don't let outdated processes slow you down—streamline your ID verification today. At Ideco Biometrics, we recognise that cybersecurity isn't just about protection—it's about partnerships. As IDEMIA's Premium Certified Solutions Partner in South Africa, we provide cutting-edge biometric security to combat identity fraud, unauthorised access, and data breaches. With ransomware and AI-driven attacks surging, businesses—especially smaller ones—must secure their future with the right allies today. Fraud and identity theft are on the rise—is your business truly protected? Traditional KYC methods leave gaps, but Ideco eKYC closes them with real-time biometric verification. Stay compliant, prevent fraud, and streamline onboarding with the future of identity management. Discover how eKYC secures your business before it's too late! As 2024 ends, we celebrate a year of groundbreaking innovation, strong partnerships, and industry-leading biometric solutions. From enhancing security with IDEMIA's cutting-edge technology to empowering professionals through the Ideco Academy, we've set new benchmarks. As we step into 2025, we remain committed to shaping a smarter, safer future. Your identity is your most valuable asset—how secure is it? This International Identity Day, Ideco highlights the urgent need for trusted verification with its cutting-edge eKYC solution. Protect your business from fraud, compliance failures, and identity theft with real-time biometric verification. Don't wait for a breach—secure your future today. On-premises vs. cloud-based access control: Which one is right for your business? The debate comes down to control, security, scalability, and cost. On-premises solutions offer hands-on security and tailored customization, while cloud-based systems provide flexibility, scalability, and reduced IT burden. But which fits your organization's unique needs? Find out now. Discover how South Africa's use of biometric technology in the electoral process could revolutionise transparency and integrity while navigating through challenges and considerations for wider implementation. Want effortless access without sacrificing security? Discover VisionPass SP, the cutting-edge facial recognition system that streamlines entry for up to 50,000 users. Boasting iBeta Level 2 anti-spoofing, energy efficiency, and a user-friendly design, it's revolutionising access control. Learn how it can benefit your business! African governments are getting a firsthand look at the future of identity management. At ID4Africa, Ideco is unveiling a revolutionary digital identity ecosystem that integrates biometrics, authentication, and identity management into a seamless, secure system. This breakthrough could redefine service delivery, security, and trust across the continent. Visitor management is about more than just taking a record of who is coming and going. And that is if you're lucky enough to be receiving the correct information, and your security or reception desk making every single person . Biometric technology has long promised to transform the way that people interact with electronics, and for the most part, it has. Discover what it is, how it came to be and current and future uses of biometric technology. If we as humans struggle so much to recognise features on a face - how then do machines do this? Star Trek, which aired as a show in 1966 and was made into its first movie in 1979, used biometrics such as voice ID, retina scan, and facial recognition. In today's fast paced, digitally forward world, companies look for ways to save time as well as costs by simplifying internal systems. The idea of having to login to multiple systems for one process is a pain, so systems that work together seamlessly are at the forefront of all business operational expenses. Companies want convenience where system on-boarding is simple and learning the processes and software is easy and straightforward. ‍ Protecting your digital identity is not just reserved for the cast of a first grade hacking movie, and being able to authenticate your proof of ownership is not just for those that are trading in crypto currency. In our modern tech-savvy world with interconnected devices, we should all pay a little more attention to protecting ourselves from identity fraud. Digital identity is more than just electronic IDs—it's a secure, interoperable ecosystem where individuals own and control their data. To achieve this, African governments must move beyond fragmented systems and collaborate on long-term solutions. A future-proof identity system ensures seamless service delivery, efficiency, and security across public and private sectors. True digital identity is more than just digitising physical IDs—it's about creating a secure, interoperable ecosystem where individuals own and control their identities. This requires long-term collaboration, integration, and a future-proof approach. African governments must move beyond fragmented legacy systems to build a seamless, trusted identity infrastructure for the future. With elections costing South Africa hundreds of millions, it's time to embrace biometric and digital voting technologies. From voter registration to casting ballots, next-generation systems can ensure security, efficiency, and cost savings. Estonia proves it's possible—so why is South Africa lagging behind? Now is the time to act. Imagine boarding a plane without ever showing your passport. Sydney Airport's facial recognition program is making this a reality, and South Africa could be next. With biometrics transforming banking, security, and travel, the question isn't if this will happen here—but when. Are we ready for a passport-less future? Biometrics can provide the organisation an intelligent balance of security and convenience if implemented and managed correctly. Biometrics has often been considered a risky and unreliable investment for many organisations. Its rocky reputation influenced by poorly managed and integrated installations seldom factor in key considerations such as the environment, operational impact and legalities. However, the Goode Intelligence study, found that biometric authentication delivers improved security and compliance benefits, and allows for a balance between security and convenience without compromising on either. Biometrics can provide the organisation with a balanced and accessible authentication platform that supports the customer, the business and an omnichannel strategy, but it has to be implemented correctly. There are many benefits to implementing a biometric access system for your company, premises or building, and it is not only for large corporations. In a world where it is so easy to spoof keycards and password, companies are increasingly vulnerable and protection against unauthorised guests is becoming increasingly vital. Visitor records are necessary, but the days of the grubby book-based register at the guard house are numbered, says Ideco. Filling in the visitors' register at the entrance to office blocks or residential estates is a pet peeve of most South Africans: to simply enter a site, they must balance a cumbersome visitors' book on their car steering wheel, etch out their details with a failing pen, and complete endless fields of personal information. This process takes time, may cause a backup of traffic behind the visitor completing the log, and – worst of all – puts their personal information at risk. Advanced new facial recognition technology is giving ordinary surveillance systems the ability to learn, analyse what cameras see, conduct market research and even proactively mitigate risk. Video Surveillance systems are an important step towards enhanced security, but they have certain shortfalls – they are very dependent on the ability of the control centre and monitoring team to be alert to every moment on every screen, all the time. "With surveillance cameras now in place virtually everywhere, it becomes extremely difficult to analyse who is where and what they are doing, all the time," says Marius Coetzee, CEO of SA-based identity specialists Ideco. "This means traditional surveillance footage is typically used after an event to support investigations."
